instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 No backlight
threads.message: ppvout_sw_lcdbklt 0V but there is an image on the screen.

threads.title: 820-2936 No backlight
threads.message: Any help? just messing around with some old boards i had laying around.

threads.title: 820-2936 No backlight
threads.message:
Post diode mode there first; w/ and w/o LCD connected.
Also need voltages for Q9706/07.

threads.title: 820-2936 No backlight
threads.message:
Thanks mate. As i was about to take the the voltages i think i found the problem. Corroded probe point on ppbus_s0_lcdbklt_fused.
R9788 Pin 1 0v but the backlight fuse has 12.6v on both sides.

threads.title: 820-2936 No backlight
threads.message: Thanks for guiding me in the right direction, I ran a wire and it now has a backlight cheers mate

threads.title: 820-2936 No backlight
threads.message: Glad to hear you've solved it. :)
